question: What is the difference between RED and YELLOW stakes on a golf course?*

choices.text: Yellow stakes mark areas of the ground that are under repair, Red stakes mark a hazard
You are not allowed to play your ball in a RED area, but you are in a YELLOW area
RED and YELLOW penalty areas are the same, except that in a RED area you are additionally allowed to take relief within 2 club lengths of where the ball crossed the edge not nearer the hole
You are allowed to move YELLOW stakes but not RED ones.

explanation: Red and yellow stakes on a golf course mark special areas called penalty areas. If you want to take a drop Yellow stakes mean you have to drop your ball in a straight line behind the area where your ball went in. Red stakes give you more choices: you can drop your ball on either side of the area (called "lateral relief"), not just behind it. Think of yellow stakes like a straight path you have to follow, and red stakes like a crossroad where you can choose which way to go.
